p:
Ethanolic and aqueous extracts of Baccharis genistelloides, Baccharis rubricaulis, Ambrosia arborescens, Phoradendron crassifolium, Rumex obtusifolius, Plantago australis, and Satureja boliviana, plants native to Bolivia, were tested by Abad et al.
51 for antiviral effects against HSV-1. Ethanolic extracts demonstrated high cytotoxicity, for example, the ethanolic extract of B. rubricaulis was cytotoxic at concentrations as low as 5 μg/ml. Only aqueous extracts were observed for antiviral effects, however, their maximum non-cytotoxic concentrations were at the upper limit of their effective concentration ranges The aqueous extracts that demonstrated inhibition of HSV-1 were S. boliviana, B. genistelloides, and P. crassifolium. Concentrations that were observed to show antiherpetic effects were 10-125 μg/ml, 25-50 μg/ml, and 125-500 μg/ml for S. boliviana, B. genistelloides, and P. crassifolium, respectively.
